sentences.text: The webcast will remain available for replay for three months following the meeting.

sentences.text: A Message from Our Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Shareholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board continues to fulfill its critical mission of providing active engagement and oversight of the companys strategy, capabilities, leadership and risk management, to ensure the company is well-positioned to continue creating value for shareholders in a manner that is consistent with our Credo.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: And as your representatives, my fellow independent directors and I are committed to, and value, hearing from our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is our pleasure to be part of this remarkable company that plays a vital role in the health and wellbeing of a billion people throughout the world, every day.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This past year, I had the opportunity to meet with a number of our shareholders, answer questions about the Boards perspective on corporate governance at Johnson & Johnson and, more importantly, hear direct shareholder feedback about our governance practices and emerging governance issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is committed to seeking new Board members who enhance our collective skill set and diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 2009-2015, we brought on a new independent director each year with varying and deep skill sets, as we replaced our retiring directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to seek other qualified directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We were deeply saddened at the passing of Dr. Susan Lindquist in October 2016, one of our longest-serving directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year, we altered the composition of our five key committees, with each committee having at least one new member and three committees, Compensation & Benefits, Regulatory, Compliance & Government Affairs and Science, Technology & Sustainability, each being led by a new director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee continues to be comprised solely of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can see more details on our committee composition and changes on pages 23 and 24 of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In direct response to what we heard during the course of this years shareholder engagement meetings, this year we are including a chart setting out the key skills of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are hopeful that this chart will provide shareholders with an easier format to view the collective skills and experience that enable our Board to provide strong governance and oversight to serve our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some investors suggested in our dialogues that, as a matter of principle, the roles of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer should be separate at all public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the reasons set out in our response to the shareholder proposal on page 88 of this Proxy Statement, the Board continues to have strong conviction that the current structure of combined Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, along with the establishment of a robust Lead Independent Director, works best for Johnson & Johnson and its shareholders at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I believe I was able to provide the investors with whom I met a better understanding of my role as Lead Director, how I interact with the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer and other directors, and my ongoing practice of active engagement with shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board continues to monitor developments, but believes it is critically important from a governance perspective that it retain appropriate flexibility and sole authority to determine who serves as Chairman of our company at any given point in time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I encourage you to read more about our Board, robust governance structures and practices, and compensation programs in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please also consider our recommendations to the proposals in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to vote your shares in line with the Boards recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value your engagement and thank you for your continued support and investment in Johnson & Johnson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anne M. Mulcahy Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 1: Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOMINEES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are 10 director nominees for election at our 2017 Annual Meeting, to hold office until the next Annual Meeting and until their successors have been duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the nominees were elected to the Board at the last Annual Meeting and are currently serving as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Susan Lindquist was also elected to the Board at the last Annual Meeting, but passed away on October 28, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below are summaries of the background, business experience and description of the principal occupation of each of the nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARY C. BECKERLE, Ph.D., Chief Executive Officer and Director, Huntsman Cancer Institute at the University of Utah; Distinguished Professor of Biology, College of Science, University of Utah
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With her expertise in scientific research and organizational management in the health care arena, and her active participation in national and international scientific affairs, Dr. Beckerle provides a perspective crucial to a global health care company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director since 2015; Independent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman, Science, Technology & Sustainability Committee; Member, Regulatory, Compliance & Government Affairs Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Beckerle, 62, has served as CEO and Director of Huntsman Cancer Institute since 2006 and she was appointed in 2009 to an additional key health sciences leadership role as Associate Vice President for Cancer Affairs at the University of Utah.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Beckerle joined the faculty of the University of Utah in 1986, and is a distinguished professor of biology and oncological sciences, holding the Ralph E. and Willia T. Main Presidential Professorship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Beckerle has served on the NIH Advisory Committee to the Director, on the Board of Directors of the American Association for Cancer Research, as president of the American Society for Cell Biology, and as the Chair of the American Cancer Society Council for Extramural Grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She currently serves on a number of scientific advisory boards including, the Medical Advisory Board of the Howard Hughes Medical Institute and the Scientific Advisory Boards of the National Center for Biological Sciences at the Tata Institute of Fundamental Research in India, the Mechanobiology Institute in Singapore, and the Dana Farber/Harvard Cancer Center.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Beckerle held a Guggenheim Fellowship at the Curie Institute in Paris, received the Utah Governors Medal for Science and Technology in 2001, the Sword of Hope Award from the American Cancer Society in 2004 and is an elected Fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Beckerle was also named a National Association of Corporate Directors (NACD) Governance Fellow in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Public Company Board Service: Huntsman Corporation (2011 to present)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement - 9
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: D. SCOTT DAVIS, Former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, United Parcel Service, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having served as Chairman and CEO of the worlds largest publicly-traded logistics company, and given his knowledge and passion for emerging markets and international operations, deep understanding of public policy and global economic indicators, and expertise in management, strategy, finance and operations, Mr. Davis brings to our Board his unique expertise in supply chain logistics at a time of rapid global expansion in the health care industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director since 2014; Independent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman, Audit Committee; Member, Compensation & Benefits Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Davis, 65, served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of United Parcel Service, Inc. (UPS) (shipment and logistics) from 2008 to 2014, and as Chairman from 2014 to 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Mr. Davis held various leadership positions with UPS, primarily in he finance and accounting area, including Vice Chairman and Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining UPS, he was Chief Executive Officer of II Morrow Inc., a developer of general aviation and marine navigation instruments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Davis is a Certified Public Accountant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He previously served on the Board of the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta from 2003 to 2009, serving as Chairman in 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Davis is a trustee of the Annie E. Casey Foundation and a member of The Carter Center Board of Councilors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Public Company Board Service: Honeywell International, Inc. (2005 to present)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recent Past Public Company Board Service: United Parcel Service, Inc. (2008 to 2016); EndoChoice, Inc. (2014 to 2016)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IAN E. L. DAVIS, Chairman, Rolls-Royce Holdings plc; Former Chairman and Worldwide Managing Director, McKinsey & Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having served as Chairman and Worldwide Managing Director of one of the worlds leading management consulting firms, and as a consultant to a range of global organizations across the public, private and not-for-profit sectors, Mr. Davis brings considerable global experience, management insight and business knowledge to our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director since 2010; Independent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Member, Audit Committee; Member, Regulatory, Compliance & Government Affairs Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Davis, 66, is currently non-executive Chairman, Rolls-Royce Holdings plc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Davis retired from McKinsey & Company (management consulting) in 2010 as a Senior Partner, having served as Chairman and Worldwide Managing Director from 2003 until 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In his more than 30 years at McKinsey, he served as a consultant to a range of global organizations across the public, private and not-for-profit sectors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to becoming Chairman and Worldwide Managing Director, he was Managing Partner of McKinseys practice in the United Kingdom and Ireland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His experience included oversight for McKinsey clients and services in Asia, Europe, the Middle East and Africa, as well as expertise in the consumer products and retail industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Davis is a Director of Teach for All, Inc., a global network of independent social enterprises working to expand educational opportunities in their nations; global energy group, BP plc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ; and Majid Al Futtaim Holding LLC; and a Senior Advisor at Apax Partners, a private equity firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Public Company Board Service: BP plc (2010 to present); Rolls-Royce Holdings plc (2013 to present)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement - 10
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ALEX GORSKY, Chairman, Board of Directors; Chief Executive Officer; Chairman, Executive Committee, Johnson & Johnson
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having started his career at Johnson & Johnson in 1988 and having been promoted to positions of increasing responsibility across business segments, culminating in his appointment to CEO and election to our Board of Directors in 2012, Mr. Gorsky brings a full range of strategic management expertise, a broad understanding of the issues facing a multinational business in the health care industry and an in-depth knowledge of the companys business, history and culture to our Board and the Chairman position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director since 2012; Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman, Finance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gorsky, 56, was appointed as Chairman, Board of Directors in December 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was named Chief Executive Officer, Chairman of the Executive Committee and joined the Board of Directors in April 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gorsky began his Johnson & Johnson career with Janssen Pharmaceutica Inc. in 1988.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the next 15 years, he advanced through positions of increasing responsibility in sales, marketing, and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2001, Mr. Gorsky was appointed President of Janssen Pharmaceutical Inc., and in 2003 he was named Company Group Chairman of the Johnson & Johnson pharmaceutical business in Europe, the Middle East and Africa.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gorsky left Johnson & Johnson in 2004 to join Novartis Pharmaceuticals Corporation, where he served as head of the companys pharmaceutical business in North America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gorsky returned to Johnson & Johnson in 2008 as Company Group Chairman for Ethicon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In early 2009, he was appointed Worldwide Chairman of the Surgical Care Group and member of the Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2009, he was appointed Worldwide Chairman of the Medical Devices and Diagnostics Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gorsky became Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee in January 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gorsky also serves on the boards of the Travis Manion Foundation, the Congressional Medal of Honor Foundation and the National Academy Foundation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Public Company Board Service: International Business Machines Corporation (IBM) (2014 to present)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARK B. McCLELLAN, M.D., Ph.D., Director, Duke-Robert J. Margolis, MD, Center for ealth Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With his extensive experience in public health policy, including as Commissioner of the U.S. Food and Drug Administration and Administrator for the U.S. Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services, Dr. McClellan possesses broad knowledge of, and unique insights into, the challenges facing the health care industry, making him a valuable member of the board of a broad-based health care company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director since 2013; Independent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Member, Regulatory, Compliance & Government Affairs Committee; Member, Science, Technology & Sustainability Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. McClellan, 53, became the inaugural Director of the Duke-Robert J. Margolis, MD, Center for Health Policy in January 2016, and the Margolis Professor of Business, Medicine and Policy at Duke University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is also a faculty member at Dell Medical School at The University of Texas in Austin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, he served from 2007 to 2015 as a Senior Fellow in Economic Studies, and Director of the Initiatives on Value and Innovation in Health Care at the Brookings Institution.

sentences.text: BOARD COMPOSITION AND DIRECTOR NOMINATION PROCESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee of the Board of Directors annually considers the size, composition and needs of the Board, reviews possible candidates for the Board, and recommends the nominees for directors to the Board for approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers and evaluates suggestions from many sources, including shareholders, regarding possible candidates for directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such suggestions, together with appropriate biographical information, should be submitted to the Office of the Corporate Secretary at our principal office address.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below are the General Criteria for Nomination to the Board of Directors, which, as part of the Principles of Corporate Governance, are posted at www.investor.jnj.com/gov.cfm:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: l The highest ethical character and shared values with Our Credo
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: l Reputation, both personal and professional, consistent with our image and reputation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: l Accomplishment within candidates field, with superior credentials and recognition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: l Active and former chief executive officers of public companies and leaders of major complex organizations, including scientific, government, educational and other non-profit institutions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: l Widely recognized leaders in the fields of medicine or biological sciences, including those who have received the most prestigious awards and honors in their fields
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: l Relevant expertise and experience and the ability to offer advice and guidance to the CEO based on that expertise and experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: l Independence, without the appearance of any conflict in serving as a Director, and independence of any particular constituency with the ability to represent all shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: l Ability to exercise sound business judgment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: l Diversity, reflecting differences in skills, regional and industry experience, background, race, ethnicity, gender and other unique characteristics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Understanding the importance of Board composition and refreshment for effective oversight, the Nominating  & Corporate Governance Committee strives to maintain a diverse Board of Directors, with diversity reflecting differences in skills, regional and industry experience, background, race, ethnicity, gender and other unique characteristics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board is committed to seeking out highly qualified women and minority candidates as well as candidates with diverse backgrounds, skills and experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD LEADERSHIP STRUCTURE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman of the Board and CEO: Alex Gorsky
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Lead Director: Anne M. Mulcahy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both positions designated annually by the independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All 5 main Board Committees composed of independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent directors met in executive session at each of the 9 regular 2016 Board meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Directors believe that there are positives and negatives related to all possible board leadership structures, which must be considered in the context of the specific circumstances, culture and challenges facing a company, and that such consideration falls squarely on the shoulders of a companys board, holding a diversity of views and experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in Item 1: Election of Directors on pages 9 to 14 of this Proxy Statement, our Directors come from a variety of organizational backgrounds with direct experience in a wide range of leadership and management structures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, our independent Directors appropriately challenge management and demonstrate the free-thinking expected of todays directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given this, our Board is in a very strong position to evaluate the various types of board leadership structures and to ultimately decide which one will work in the best interests of our stakeholders, as they are defined in Our Credo (on the back cover of this Proxy Statement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that it remains in our companys best interests for Mr. Gorsky to serve as Chairman of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having Mr. Gorsky, our company's CEO, serve as Chairman creates clear and unambiguous authority, which is essential to effective management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, given that he is closer to our companys businesses than any other Board member and has the benefit of over 20 years of operational and leadership experience within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, Mr. Gorsky is best positioned to provide effective leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gorskys career experience gives him unsurpassed industry knowledge, which the Board believes is critical for the chairman of the board of a company that operates in a highly-regulated industry, such as health care.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board, through its Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee, will continue to periodically review its leadership structure in a serious and open-minded fashion to ensure it remains appropriate for our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our Board believes that it continues to be in the companys best interests for Mr. Gorsky to serve as Chairman of our Board, the Board is committed to regularly considering all board leadership structures and assessing the role that independent directors play in the leadership of the board, including at the time of the next leadership succession.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board will continue to monitor this topic in light of what it observes in the marketplace, the evolution of viewpoints in the corporate governance community, and, most importantly, what the Board believes is in the best interests of Johnson & Johnson and its stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recognizes the importance of having in place, and building upon, a strong structure to ensure that the Board functions in an appropriately independent manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the same time that our Board decided to designate Mr. Gorsky as Chairman in 2012, our independent Directors took steps to enhance our governance structure by converting the Presiding Director role to that of an independent Lead Director and expanding the duties of the independent Lead Director to include all of the duties and responsibilities of the companys former Presiding Director position as well as several additional duties and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table describes the duties and responsibilities of our independent Lead Director, which are also incorporated into our Principles of Corporate Governance, found at www.investor.jnj.com/gov.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Duties and Responsibilities of the Independent Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Agendas and Schedules  Approves information sent to the Board and determines timeliness of information flow from management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Periodically provides feedback on quality and quantity of information flow from management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participates in setting, and ultimately approves, the agenda for each Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approves meeting schedules to assure that there is sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the Chair/CEO, determines who attends Board meetings, including management and outside advisors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee Agendas and Schedules  Reviews in advance the schedule of committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitors flow of information from Committee Chairs to the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Executive Sessions  Has the authority to call meetings and Executive Sessions of the Independent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Presides at all meetings of the Board at which the Chair/CEO is not present, including Executive Session of the Independent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communicating with Management  After each Executive Session of the Independent Directors, communicates with the Chair/CEO to provide feedback and also to effectuate the decisions and recommendations of the Independent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acts as liaison between the Independent Directors and the Chair/CEO and management on a regular basis and when special circumstances exist or communication out of the ordinary course is necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communicating with Stakeholders  As necessary, meets with major shareholders or other external parties, after discussions with the Chair/CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Is regularly apprised of inquiries from shareholders and involved in correspondence responding to these inquiries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Boards guidelines for handling shareholder and employee communications to the Board, is advised promptly of any communications directed to the Board or any member of the Board that allege misconduct on the part of company management, or raise legal, ethical or compliance concerns about company policies or practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chair and CEO Performance Evaluations   Leads the annual performance evaluation of the Chair/CEO, distinguishing as necessary between performance as Chair and performance as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Performance Evaluation   Leads the annual performance evaluation of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Board Member Recruiting  Interviews Board candidates, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Succession   Leads the CEO succession process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Crisis Management   Plays an increased role in crisis management oversight, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits on Leadership Positions of Other Boards   May only serve as chair, lead or presiding director, or similar role, or as CEO or similar role at another public company if approved by the full Board upon recommendation from the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that all non-employee directors who served during fiscal 2016 are independent under the listing standards of the NYSE and our Standards of Independence, including: Dr. Beckerle, Mr. I. E. L. Davis, Mr. D. S. Davis, Dr. McClellan, Ms. Mulcahy, Mr. Perez, Mr. Prince, Dr. Washington and Mr. Williams.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These Standards conform to, or are more exacting than, the NYSE independence standards and identify, among other things, material business, charitable and other relationships that could interfere with a directors ability to exercise independent judgment.

sentences.text: The Board considered each of these relationships in light of the NYSE independence standards and our Standards of Independence and determined that none of these relationships conflict with the interests of the company or would impair the relevant non-employee directors independence or judgment.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engage with our shareholders throughout the year to seek input on emerging governance issues and to address their questions and concerns regarding our current governance policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our Lead Director, our Chairman and CEO, and the members of senior management had discussions with a diverse mix of our shareholders on a variety of corporate governance issues, including on our board composition and skills, our Board leadership structure, our political activities and expenditures, and our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of those constructive conversations, we took the following actions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expanded our Proxy Statement disclosures on board composition and skills to include a chart setting out the qualities, attributes, skills and experiences of our Board (see page 15).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee carefully considered the feedback from certain shareholders on combining the Chairman and CEO roles, but concluded that it continues to be in the companys best interests for Mr. Gorsky to serve as Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is committed to regularly considering all board leadership structures and assessing the role that independent directors play in the leadership of the board, including at the time of the next leadership succession (see page 16).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expanded our website disclosure on political activities and expenditures, including with respect to our membership in U.S. trade associations (see page 23).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation & Benefits Committee reviewed the feedback received on our executive compensation programs and increased the weighting of performance share units in our 2017 long-term incentive mix to increase the focus on long-term performance (see page 50).

sentences.text: RISK OVERSIGHT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Oversight of Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that overseeing managements processes for assessing and managing the various risks we face is one of its most important responsibilities to our stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our enterprise risk management framework reflects a collaborative process, whereby our Board of Directors, management and other personnel apply a common risk management approach to strategy setting and other decisions across the enterprise that is designed to identify potential events that may affect the entity and manage the associated risks and opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the interrelated nature of the risks we face, the Board believes that oversight of risk management is ultimately the responsibility of the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out this critical responsibility, the Board meets at regular intervals with key members of management with primary responsibility for risk management in their respective areas of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The subject matter of these meetings can generally be grouped into the following categories and risk areas:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategy Business Vitality Strategic Planning Talent Management Reputation Sustainability Diversity Reporting Financial Results Finance/Accounting Internal Audit Independent Audit Tax Treasury Compliance Law/Legal Proceedings Legislative/Regulatory Environment Health Care Compliance Foreign Corrupt Practices Act Environment, Health & Safety Privacy Quality Product Safety/Scientific Issues Operations Supply Chain (including Manufacturing/Business Continuity Planning) Security (including security of products, sites, personnel, and information) Cybersecurity Research & Development
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement - 20
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also receives regular reports on certain elements of our risk management from senior representatives of our independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee meets in private sessions with the Chief Financial Officer; General Counsel; Vice President of Internal Audit; and representatives of our independent auditor at the conclusion of every regularly-scheduled meeting, where risk management is discussed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Regulatory, Compliance & Government Affairs Committee meets in private sessions with the General Counsel; Chief Compliance Officer; Chief Quality Officer; and Vice President of Internal Audit, where risk management is discussed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the Johnson & Johnson Framework for Enterprise Risk Management can be found at www.jnj.com/about-jnj/management- approach.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Related to Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following characteristics of our executive compensation program work to reduce the possibility that our executive officers, either individually or as a group, make excessively risky business decisions that could maximize short-term results at the expense of long- term value:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balanced Mix of Pay Components: The target compensation mix is not overly weighted toward annual incentive awards and represents a balance of cash and long-term equity-based compensation vesting over three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See 2016 Pay Mix at Target on page 53.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balanced Approach to Performance-Based Awards:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance targets are tied to multiple financial metrics, including operational sales growth, free cash flow, adjusted earnings per share growth, and long-term total shareholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based awards are based on the achievement of strategic and leadership objectives in addition to financial metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Base Salary, Annual Performance Bonus, and Long-Term Incentives on page  52.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Period and Vesting Schedules: The performance period and vesting schedules for long-term incentives overlap, and therefore, reduce the motivation to maximize performance in any one period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Share Units, Restricted Share Units, and Stock Options vest three years from the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Capped Incentive Awards: Annual performance bonuses and long-term incentive awards are capped at 200% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Aligning Compensation to "The What" & "The How"" on page  56.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines: These guidelines require our CEO to directly or indirectly own equity in our company of six times salary, and the other members of our Executive Committee (the principal management group) to own equity of three times salary, and to retain this level of equity at all times while serving as an Executive Committee member.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Stock Ownership Guidelines for Named Executive Officers on page 58.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Recoupment Policy: This Policy gives our Board authority to recoup executive officers past compensation in the event of a material restatement of our financial results and for events involving material violations of company policy relating to the manufacturing, sales or marketing of our products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Executive Compensation Recoupment Policy on page 59.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Change-in-Control Arrangements: None of our executive officers have in place any change-in-control arrangements that would result in guaranteed payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement - 21
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADDITIONAL GOVERNANCE FEATURES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Access
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, as part of our long-standing shareholder outreach program, we engaged with a number of our shareholders regarding proxy access and the potential terms of proxy access provisions that our shareholders would view as appropriate for Johnson & Johnson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After taking into account the feedback provided as part of these discussions and considering developments in market practice, in January 2016, we amended our By-Laws to implement proxy access with the following key parameters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ownership threshold: 3% of outstanding shares of our common stock Holding period: Continuously for 3 years Number of nominees: Up to 20% of our Board, with a minimum of up to two Board seats if Board size is less than 10 Nominating group size: Up to 20 shareholders may group together to reach the 3% ownership threshold
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to believe this proxy access framework reflects a thoughtfully designed and balanced approach to proxy access that mitigates the risk of abuse and protects the interests of all of our shareholders, while affording a meaningful proxy access right in light of our size and shareholder base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who wish to nominate directors for inclusion in our Proxy Statement in accordance with the proxy access procedures in our By-Laws should follow the instructions under General Information on page 94.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority Voting In Uncontested Director Elections
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our By-Laws require that in uncontested elections (those where the number of nominees does not exceed the number of directors to be elected), director nominees receive the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast in order to be elected to our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contested director elections (those where the number of director nominees exceeds the number of directors to be elected) would be governed by the plurality standard under New Jersey law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a Director Resignation Policy for Incumbent Directors in Uncontested Elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, if an incumbent director receives more votes Against his or her election than votes For his or her election in an uncontested election, then such director must promptly tender an offer of his or her resignation following certification of the shareholder vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee and the Board would then consider and take appropriate action on such offer of resignation in accordance with the Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our By-Laws and Principles of Corporate Governance, including the Director Resignation Policy for Incumbent Directors in Uncontested Elections, can be found at www.investor.jnj.com/gov.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Overboarding Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Principles of Corporate Governance state that a director who serves as a CEO (or similar position) at our, or any other, company should not serve on more than two public company boards (including the Johnson & Johnson board and his or her own board) and that other directors should not serve on more than five public company boards (including the Johnson & Johnson board).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, all of our Directors are in compliance with this policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a leader in the healthcare industry, Johnson & Johnson is committed to supporting the development of sound public policy in health care.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We work with many organizations across the political spectrum on a variety of policy issues related to health and other opics that impact patients, consumers, and our company.

sentences.text: As a result of constructive engagement with a number of our institutional nvestors, we were an early mover on the disclosure of corporate political expenditures and activities, and we have expanded that disclosure over the years as we continue to dialogue with our shareholders on this issue.

sentences.text: Disclosure regarding the companys political activities and expenditures, including the policies and procedures that govern that activity and spending, as well as the Boards oversight role, are updated semi-annually and can be found at www.investor.jnj.com/gov/contributions.cfm.

sentences.text: This year, in response to shareholder engagement on this topic, we have enhanced our website disclosure by including the following:

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to transparency, our Board believes oversight of political activities and expenditures is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our written Policy on Transactions with Related Persons requires the approval or ratification by the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee for any transaction or series of transactions exceeding $120,000 in which the company is a participant and any related person has a direct or indirect material interest (other than solely as a result of being a director or trustee or less than 10% owner of another entity).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related persons include our Directors and executive officers and their immediate family members and persons sharing their households.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also includes persons controlling more than 5% of our outstanding common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Principles of Corporate Governance and Code of Business Conduct & Ethics for Members of the Board of Directors and Executive Officers, all of our Directors and executive officers have a duty to report to the Chairman or the Lead Director potential conflicts of interest, including transactions with related persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management also has established procedures for monitoring transactions that could be subject to approval or ratification under the Policy on Transactions with Related Persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once a related person transaction has been identified, the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee ("Committee") will review all of the relevant facts and circumstances and approve or disapprove of the entry into the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will take into account, among other factors, whether the transaction is on terms no more favorable than terms generally available to an unaffiliated third party under the same or similar circumstances and the extent of the related persons interest in the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If advance Committee approval of a transaction is not feasible, the transaction will be considered for ratification at the Committees next regularly scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a transaction relates to a member of the Committee, that member will not participate in the Committees deliberations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee Chairman (or, if the transaction relates to the Committee Chairman, the Lead Director) may pre-approve or ratify any related person transactions involving up to $1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following types of transactions have been deemed by the Committee to be pre-approved or ratified, even if the aggregate amount involved will exceed $120,000:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation paid by the company for service as a Director or executive officer of the company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions with other companies where the related persons only relationship is as a non-executive employee, less than 10% equity owner, or limited partner, and the transaction does not exceed the greater of $1 million or 2% of that companys annual revenues
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contributions by the company to charitable organizations where the related person is an employee and the transaction does not exceed the lesser of $500,000 or 2% of the charitable organizations annual receipts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions where the related persons only interest is as a holder of company stock and all holders receive proportiona benefits, such as the payment of regular quarterly dividends
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions involving competitive bids
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions where the rates or charges are regulated by law or government authority
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions involving bank depositary, transfer agent, registrar, trustee under a trust indenture, or party performing similar banking services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Policy on Transactions with Related Persons can be found at www.investor.jnj.com/gov.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 2: Advisory Vote on Frequency of Voting to Approve Named Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that having an advisory vote to approve named executive officer compensation EVERY ONE (1) YEAR is a meaningful and effective way to use this method of gathering feedback on the Companys executive compensation philosophy, policies and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board of Directors recommends that shareholders vote, in an advisory manner, to hold an advisory vote to approve named executive officer compensation EVERY ONE (1) YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking shareholders to vote, in an advisory manner, on whether the advisory vote to approve named executive officer compensation should occur every one, two, or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our prior say-on-frequency vote occurred in 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that years annual meeting, shareholders agreed with the Boards recommendation that advisory votes to approve executive compensation should occur every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After careful consideration, the Board again believes that submitting the advisory vote to approve our named executive officer compensation program EVERY ONE (1) YEAR is appropriate for our company and our shareholders at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An annual advisory vote is consistent with our objective of engaging in regular dialogue with our shareholders on corporate governance and executive compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that holding the advisory vote to approve named executive officer compensation annually allows for frequent and timely feedback from shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Receiving feedback from shareholders on executive compensation philosophy, policies and procedures is important to us, and we regularly engage with shareholders to hear and understand their specific concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will continue to do so as we continue to believe that direct engagement is the most meaningful way to conduct dialogue with our investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory vote on frequency is required pursuant to Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act, as amended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an advisory vote, the results of this vote will not be binding on the Board or the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the vote is advisory and non-binding, the Board values the opinions of our shareholders, and will consider the outcome of this advisory vote when determining the frequency of the advisory vote to approve named executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy card gives you four choices for voting on this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can choose whether the say-on-pay vote should be conducted EVERY ONE (1) YEAR, EVERY TWO (2) YEARS or EVERY THREE (3) YEARS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also abstain from voting on this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are not voting to approve or disapprove the Boards recommendation on this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 3: Advisory Vote to Approve Named Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that shareholders vote, in an advisory manner, FOR approval of the compensation of our named executive officers and the executive compensation philosophy, policies and procedures described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) section of the 2017 Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recognizes that executive compensation is an important matter for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guiding principles of our executive compensation philosophy and practice continue to be: Competitiveness; Pay for Performance; Accountability for Short- and Long-Term Performance; and Alignment to Shareholders Interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overarching these principles is adherence to Our Credo values, which emphasize the manner in which our financial and strategic objectives are achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our compensation programs are strongly aligned with the long-term interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When casting your 2017 Say on Pay vote, we encourage you to consider:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The alignment of the 2016 compensation of our Chairman/CEO and our other named executive officers with our companys 2016 performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pay-for-performance alignment built into the design of our incentive programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our continued evaluation of our executive compensation program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our continued direct engagement with our shareholders, resulting this year in increased weighting of performance share units in our 2017 long-term incentive mix to increase the focus on long-term performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an advisory vote, the results of this vote will not be binding on the Board or the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board of Directors values the opinions of our shareholders, and will consider the outcome of the vote when making future decisions on the compensation of our named executive officers and our executive compensation philosophy, policies and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is recommending to continue annual advisory votes on executive compensation in Item 2 of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, following our 2017 shareholder meeting on April 27, 2017 the next advisory vote on executive compensation is expected to occur at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, unless shareholders vote for a different frequency and the Board of Directors modifies its policy on the frequency of holding such advisory votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that the executive compensation program includes key features that align the interests of the named executive officers and Johnson & Johnsons long-term strategic direction with shareholders and does not include features that could misalign their interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do  What We Don't Do  Align CEO pay with company performance    No automatic or guaranteed annual salary        increases  Use long-term incentives to link the majority of        named executive officer pay to company    No guaranteed bonuses or long term incentive   performance    awards           Balance short-term and long-term incentives    No above-median targeting of executive        compensation  Cap incentive awards             No change-in-control benefits  Require named executive officers to own        significant amounts of company stock    No tax gross-ups (unless they are provided        pursuant to our standard relocation practices)  Have a compensation recoupment policy        applicable to our named executive officers    No option repricing without shareholder        approval  Actively engage with our shareholders             No hedging of company stock  Use an independent compensation consultant        reporting directly to the Compensation & Benefits    No long-term incentive backdating   Committee             No dividend equivalents on unvested long-term        incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IMPORTANCE OF CREDO VALUES IN ASSESSING PERFORMANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For over 70 years, the Johnson & Johnson Credo has guided us in fulfilling our responsibilities to our customers, employees, communities, and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In assessing our named executive officers contributions to Johnson & Johnsons performance, the Committee not only looks to results-oriented measures of performance, but also considers how those results were achieved  whether the decisions and actions leading to the results were consistent with the values embodied in Our Credo  and the long-term impact of a named executive officers decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Credo-based behavior is not something that can be precisely measured; thus, there is no formula for how Credo-based behavior can, or will, impact an executives compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee and the Chairman/CEO use their judgment and experience to evaluate whether an executives actions were aligned with our Credo values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GUIDING PRINCIPLES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We design our executive compensation programs to achieve our goals of attracting, developing, and retaining global business leaders who can drive financial and strategic growth objectives and build long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use the following guiding principles to design our compensation programs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitiveness: We compare our practices against appropriate peer companies that are of similar size and complexity, so we can continue to attract, retain, and motivate high-performing executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance: Annual bonuses and grants of long-term incentives are tied to performance, including the performance of the individual named executive officer and his or her specific business unit or function, as well as the overall performance of our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accountability for Short- and Long-Term Performance: We structure performance-based compensation to reward an appropriate balance of short- and long-term financial and strategic business results, with an emphasis on managing the business for long-term results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described under Risk Oversight on pages 20 and 21, the full Board is responsible for oversight of risk management (including product development, supply chain, and quality risks) and the executive compensation programs emphasis on long-term value helps to reduce the possibility that our executive officers make excessively risky business decisions that could maximize short-term results at the expense of long-term value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alignment to Shareholders Interests: We structure performance-based compensation to align the interests of our named executive officers with the long-term interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE PERQUISITES & OTHER BENEFITS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers received the same employee benefits provided to all other non-union U.S. employees, with the exception of the Executive Life Insurance Program, which is provided to approximately 200 executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 2015, the executive life insurance program was closed to new participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the benefits offered to all employees, our named executive officers were provided benefits intended for business purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In some cases, these benefits may be used for personal use, which would then be considered part of the named executive officers total compensation and would be treated as taxable income under the applicable tax laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, this included: limited access to the company aircraft for personal travel, access to company cars and drivers for commutation and other personal transportation, and reimbursement of home security system related fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive life insurance premiums paid, values of personal use of company aircraft and cars, and home security related costs, are disclosed in the Summary Compensation Table under All Other Compensation (Column H) on page 60.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION TARGET SETTING PROCESS AND PAY POSITION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before each fiscal year begins, we set compensation targets to ensure that we can compete for talent and to maintain compensation equity and balance among positions with similar responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An annual review of publicly available information and executive compensation surveys is conducted to determine current Executive Peer Group pay levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews market data to understand how our target pay levels compare to benchmark positions, but does not target total compensation to a specific percentile of the Executive Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In deciding on compensation for individual named executive officers, the Committee considers the individuals performance and alignment with our Credo values, our internal bonus and long- term incentive opportunities as a percent of salary, the individuals roles and responsibilities, and his or her experience in role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 PAY MIX AT TARGET
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pay mix at target for our named executive officers is a result of the compensation targets that emphasize long-term compensation versus short-term compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer Groups for Pay and Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses two peer groups for executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Peer Group is used to assess the competitiveness of the compensation of our named executive officers, and the Competitor Composite Peer Group is used to evaluate the relative performance of our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described below, the two peer groups vary because executive compensation levels and practices are influenced by business complexity and company size, and most of our business competitors are much smaller than Johnson & Johnson as a whole, or even as compared to each of our three individual business segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The composition of the Executive Peer Group is reviewed by the Committee on an annual basis and consists of companies that generally: are similar to Johnson & Johnson's size and scope; have executive positions similar to ours; and compete with us for executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Committee determined to add Medtronic plc to, and remove Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. from, the Executive Peer Group for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Peer Group does not include companies headquartered outside the U.S. (because comparable compensation data for the named executive officers is not available) or companies in industries whose compensation programs are not comparable to our programs, such as the financial services or oil and gas industries.

sentences.text: Compensation Decision Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ASSESSING "THE WHAT" & "THE HOW"
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We evaluate the performance of our named executive officers based on what objectives they have accomplished and how they have accomplished them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We evaluate each of them against a set of financial and strategic goals for the overall company, as well as for the business segment or function that they lead - the what.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we consider how they accomplished their goals including whether the executive achieves business results in a manner that is consistent with the values embodied in Our Credo - the how.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the first quarter of the year, the Committee reviews the companys annual financial and strategic goals for the overall enterprise and the business segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the performance period, the Chairman/CEO provides his assessment to the Committee of the what and the how for each of the other named executive officers, and the independent members of the Board of Directors evaluate the what and the how for the Chairman/CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ALIGNING COMPENSATION TO "THE WHAT" & "THE HOW"
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An individual employee has the opportunity to earn from 0% to 200% of the applicable target for annual performance bonuses and long-term incentives based on the evaluation of his or her individual performance on both the what and the how.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This broad range allows for meaningful differentiation based on performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determines annual performance bonuses, long-term incentive awards and salary increases based on a component- by-component and a total direct compensation basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee compares the position of actual compensation for the performance year, as well as compensation opportunities for the current year, to Executive Peer Group data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ultimate compensation decisions are based on the judgment and experience of the independent directors (in the case of the Chairman/CEO) and the Committee (in the case of the other named executive officers).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While performance against goals is the most significant factor, the achievement of particular goals does not determine compensation award levels in a formulaic manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, an executives previous long-term incentive awards and total equity ownership are not considered when making annual long-term incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement - 56
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is responsible for the executive compensation program design and decision-making process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee solicits input from the independent members of the Board of Directors, the Chairman/CEO and other members of management, and its independent compensation consultant, to assist it with its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following summarizes the roles of each of the key participants in the executive compensation decision-making process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION & BENEFITS COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acts on behalf of the Board by setting the principles that guide the design of our compensation and benefits programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sets the executive compensation philosophy and composition of the Executive Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approves the compensation target levels
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sets compensation programs and principles that are designed to link executive pay with company and individual performanc
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommends to the Board the Chairman/CEOs compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews and approves compensation decisions recommended by the Chairman/CEO for each of the other named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews the eligibility criteria and award guidelines for the corporate-wide compensation and benefits programs in which the named executive officers participate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participate in the performance assessment process for the Chairman/CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approve the Chairman/CEOs compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CHAIRMAN/CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews and presents to the Committee the performance assessments and compensation recommendations for each of the other named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has retained an independent compensation consultant from Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. (FWC) to advise it on executive compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has sole authority to negotiate the terms of service, including all fees paid to FW The independent compensation consultant:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attends all Committee meetings, at the request of the Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advises the Committee on market trends, regulatory issues and developments and how they may impact our executive compensation programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews the compensation strategy and executive compensation programs for alignment with our strategic business
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advises on the design of executive compensation programs to ensure the linkage between pay and performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides market data analyses to the Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advises the Committee on setting the Chairman/CEOs pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews the annual compensation of the other named executive officers as recommended by the Chairman/CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence of Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered the following factors, among others, when assessing the independence of its compensation consultant:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FWC does not provide any other services to the company and reports directly to the Committe
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FWC has in place policies and procedures to prevent conflicts of interest
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of the FWC consulting team serving the Committee has a business or personal relationship with any member of the Committee or any executive officer of the company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither FWC nor any principal of FWC owns any shares of our common stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of fees paid to FWC is less than 1% of FWC's total consulting income
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this assessment, the Committee determined FWCs service as its independent compensation consultant did not raise any conflict of interest concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to assure continuing independence, the Committee periodically considers whether there should be rotation of its independent compensation consulting firm or the lead consultant on the engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement - 57
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Information Concerning Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: USE OF TALLY SHEETS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews compensation tally sheets, prepared by management and reviewed by the Committees independent compensation consultant, which present comprehensive data on the total compensation and benefits package for each of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These tally sheets include all obligations for compensation, as well as analyses for hypothetical terminations and retirements to consider the companys obligations under such circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not use the tally sheets to determine the various elements of compensation or the actual amounts of compensation to be approved, but instead uses the tally sheets to evaluate the companys obligations under the plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LIMITED EMPLOYMENT ARRANGEMENTS AND AGREEMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers are covered by our Severance Pay Plan that provides separation benefits to certain full-time U.S. employees who are involuntarily terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This coverage provides for two weeks base salary for each year of service, with certain guaranteed minimums based on level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The minimum number of weeks of base salary continuance for our named executive officers is 52 weeks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance is paid according to our normal payroll cycle and is not available as a lump sum payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to his offer letter, Dr. Stoffels receives an annual stipend of $320,000 to assist him in the payment of foreign taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While serving as a member of the Executive Committee, Dr. Stoffels is considered a U.S. employee even though he is a non-resident of the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, Dr. Stoffels is subject to both U.S. taxation and foreign taxation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Stoffels will not receive any othe tax equalization assistance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stipend is reviewed annually by the Committee and can be terminated at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have employment arrangements or agreements with any of our named executive officers, except for Dr. Stoffels as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STOCK OWNERSHIP GUIDELINES FOR NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys stock ownership guidelines for named executive officers are intended to further align their interests with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under these guidelines, our named executive officers must comply with the following requirements:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name Stock Ownership Guideline as a Multiple of Base Salary 2016 Compliance with Stock Ownership Guidelines?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ownership Threshold Met?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) A. Gorsky 6x Yes Yes D. Caruso 3x Yes Yes P. Stoffels 3x Yes Yes S. Peterson 3x Yes Yes J. Duato 3x Yes Yes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Executive Officers have five years after first becoming subject to the guidelines to achieve the required ownership thresholds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership for the purpose of these guidelines does not include shares underlying vested or unvested stock options or unvested PSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our policy states that any named executive who has not yet met his or her respective ownership thresholds cannot sell net shares on the open market until such ownership level has been met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee of the Board monitors compliance with these guidelines on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company policy prohibits named executive officers from transacting in derivative instruments linked to the performance of the companys securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement - 58
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION RECOUPMENT POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a material restatement of the companys financial results, the Board is authorized to take such actions as it deems necessary and appropriate, including the recoupment of all or part of any bonus or other compensation paid to an executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will consider whether any executive officer received compensation based on the original financial statements because it appeared he or she achieved financial performance targets that in fact were not achieved based on the restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will also consider the accountability of any executive officer whose acts or omissions were responsible in whole or in part for the events that led to the restatement and whether such actions or omissions constituted misconduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of significant misconduct resulting in a violation of a significant company policy, law, or regulation relating to manufacturing, sales or marketing of products that causes material harm to Johnson & Johnson, the Board is authorized to recoup compensation from senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation recoupment policies can be found on our website at www.investor.jnj.com/gov/compensation-recoupment-policy.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TAX IMPACT ON COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that preserving tax deductibility is an important, but not the sole, objective when designing executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In certain circumstances, the company may authorize compensation arrangements that are not fully tax deductible, but which promote other important objectives, such as attracting and retaining global business leaders who can drive financial and strategic growth objectives that maximize long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 threshold, target, and maximum annual performance bonus amounts for our named executive officers are reported in the "Grants of Plan-Based Awards" table on page 66.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in order to preserve the tax deductibility of the annual performance bonuses, under section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code, as amended, the bonuses for our named executive officers are subject to the limits of our Executive Incentive Plan (EIP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the EIP, individual bonuses cannot exceed 0.08% of Consolidated Net Earnings for the Chairman/CEO and any Vice Chairman and 0.04% of Consolidated Net Earnings for any other named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has reviewed our compensation plans with regard to the deduction limitation under the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 (the Act) and the final regulations interpreting the Act that have been adopted by the U.S. Internal Revenue Service and the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review, the Committee believes that a significant portion of the compensation paid to our named executive officers qualifies as performance-based compensation for purposes of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, and is, therefore, fully deductible for federal income tax purposes.

sentences.text: Annuity benefits payable under the U.S. plans are calculated as:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Final average earnings multiplied by 1.667%, multiplied by years of service prior to 2005, plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Final average earnings multiplied by 1.55%, multiplied by years of service after 2004, minus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this formula, final average earnings is defined as the average of the highest consecutive 60 months out of the last 120 months of pay, including base salary and bonus, and dividend equivalents paid or deferred on nonvested CLCs for years prior to 2009.

sentences.text: The formula above produces the amount payable as a monthly annuity for the life of the named executive officer beginning as early as age 62.
