sentences.text: Benefits can begin as early as age 55, but are subject to a 4% per year reduction for the number of years before age 62 that benefits begin.

sentences.text: The Salaried Pension Plan applies this formula to pay up to the IRSs covered compensation limit ($265,000 in 2016).

sentences.text: The Excess Pension Plan is a restorative supplemental retirement plan that uses the same formula (including the definition of final average earnings) as the Salaried Pension Plan without applying the IRS pay limits and is offset by amounts paid from the Salaried Pension Plan.

sentences.text: Any U.S. non-union employee participates in the Excess Pension Plan if his or her covered compensation exceeds the IRS limit.

sentences.text: Because Dr. Stoffels has provided periods of service in both Belgium and the U.S., his total Salaried Plan amount includes benefits from both the U.S. and Belgian Plans.

sentences.text: Item 4: Re-approval of the Material Terms of Performance Goals Under the 2012 Long-Term Incentive Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECOMMENDATION & OVERVIEW
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR re-approval of the material terms of the performance goals under our 2012 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the Plan) in order to allow for certain awards under the Plan to qualify as tax-deductible performance-based compensation as described in this Item 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes our ability to grant equity-based awards that qualify as performance-based under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code (the Code) is important to enhancing shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan, approved by shareholders in 2012, provides for the grant of incentive stock options, non-qualified stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted shares, restricted share units, performance shares and performance share units to our employees and non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to allow for awards under the Plan to qualify as tax-deductible performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) of the Code, we are asking shareholders to re-approve the material terms of the performance goals under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There can be no guarantee, however, that amounts payable under the Plan will be treated as qualified performance-based compensation under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are not being asked to approve any amendment to the Plan or to approve the Plan itself.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These terms are the same as those that the shareholders previously approved in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of this Item 4 will not increase the number of shares available for issuance under the Plan or otherwise increase the potential dilution to shareholders as a result of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Code
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that it is in the best interests of the company and its shareholders to continue to provide for an equity incentive plan under which compensation awards can be made to our executive officers that are intended to qualify for deductibility by the company for federal income tax purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, under Section 162(m), in order for the company to be able to deduct compensation in excess of $1,000,000 paid in any one year to our chief executive officer or any of our three other most highly compensated executive officers (other than our chief financial officer), such compensation must qualify as performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of the requirements of performance-based compensation for purposes of Section 162(m) is that the material terms of the performance goals under which compensation may be paid be disclosed to and approved by the companys shareholders at least once every five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of Section 162(m), the material terms include
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the employees eligible to receive compensation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a description of the business criteria on which the performance goal is based and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the maximum amount of compensation that can be paid to an employee under the performance goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the various types of awards under the Plan, each of these aspects is discussed below, and, as noted above, shareholders are being asked under this proposal to approve each of these aspects of the Plan for purposes of the approval requirements of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our shareholders do not approve the material terms of the performance goals under the Plan, there will be no impact on the terms of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan will continue to remain in existence and awards may continue to be made in accordance with the terms of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a summary of the material terms of the Plan, see the Plan Summary below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PLAN SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following summary of the material terms of the Plan are qualified in their entirety by reference to the full text of the Plan, which is attached as Appendix A to this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan is administered by the Compensation & Benefits Committee of the Board (the Committee), or, in the absence of the Committee, the Board itself.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the express provisions of the Plan, the Committee is authorized and empowered to do all things that it determines to be necessary or appropriate in connection with the administration of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent permitted by aw, the Committee may delegate its authority to one or more of its members or other persons, except that no such delegation is permitted with respect to awards granted to participants who are subject to Section 16 of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors that are also our employees or employees of our domestic subsidiaries, our non-employee directors and those of any of our subsidiaries or affiliates (Non-Employee Directors), our employees and those of our domestic subsidiaries (including our executive officers), employees of international subsidiaries and joint venture operations of Johnson & Johnson and its subsidiaries, and employees of joint venture partners who are assigned to any such joint ventures are eligible for selection by the administrator for the grant of awards under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options intending to qualify as incentive stock options (ISOs) within the meaning of Section 422 of the Code may only be granted to our employees and those of our subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of January 2, 2017, approximately 20,000 employees and 9 Non-Employee Directors qualified for participation in the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares Subject to the Plan and to Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total number of shares of our common stock that may be delivered pursuant to awards under the Plan is 650,000,000, plus any shares of common stock that were subject to outstanding awards under the Johnson & Johnson 2005 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the Prior Plan) as of April 26, 2012 that are subsequently canceled, expired, forfeited or otherwise not issued under a Prior Plan award or settled in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shares issued under options or stock appreciation rights will be counted against the number of shares issuable under the Plan on a one-for-one basis and any shares issued pursuant to awards other than options or stock appreciation rights will be counted against this limit as 5.99 shares of common stock for every one (1) share of common stock subject to such award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares of common stock subject to Prior Plan awards that, after April 26, 2012, are canceled, expired, forfeited or otherwise not issued under the Prior Plan award or settled in cash will be added to the number of shares of common stock issuable under the Plan as one (1) share of common stock if such shares were subject to options or stock appreciation rights granted under the Prior Plan, and as 5.99 shares of common stock if such shares were subject to awards other than options or stock appreciation rights granted under the Prior Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such shares may be either authorized but unissued shares, treasury shares or shares acquired on the open market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate number of shares issued under the Plan at any time may only equal the number of shares actually issued upon exercise or settlement of an award and shares subject to awards that have been canceled, expired, forfeited or otherwise not issued under an award and shares subject to awards settled in cash will be available for delivery in connection with future awards under the Plan; provided, however, that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) shares subject to a stock-settled stock appreciation right that were not issued upon the net settlement or net exercise of such stock appreciation right,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) shares delivered to or withheld by our company to pay the exercise price of an option,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) shares delivered to or withheld by our company to pay the withholding taxes related to an option or stock appreciation right, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) shares repurchased on the open market with cash proceeds from the exercise of an option will reduce the total number of shares available for delivery under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shares that again become available for grant will be added back as one (1) share of common stock if such shares were subject to options or stock appreciation rights and 5.99 shares of common stock if such shares were subject to awards other than options or stock appreciation rights granted under the Plan or the Prior Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shares delivered under the Plan upon exercise or satisfaction of a substitute award in connection with any acquisition, merger, consolidation or otherwise will not reduce the shares available for delivery under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate number of shares available for grant under the Plan and the number of shares subject to outstanding awards is subject to adjustment upon a change in our capitalization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum aggregate number of shares subject that may be granted pursuant to options and stock appreciation rights during any calendar year to any one participant is 5,000,000 (50,000 shares in the case of a Non-Employee Director).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum aggregate number of shares that may be granted subject to awards other than options or stock appreciation rights during any calendar year to any one participant is 500,000 (5,000 shares in the case of a Non-Employee Director).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum number of shares under awards other than options or stock appreciation rights that may be granted to any one participant for a performance period lasting

sentences.text: Federal Income Tax Treatment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following discussion of the federal income tax consequences of the Plan is intended to be a summary of applicable federal law as currently in effect.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It should not be taken as tax advice by Plan participants, who are urged to consult their individual tax advisors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ISOs and NQSOs are treated differently for federal income tax purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ISOs are intended to comply with the requirements of Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NQSOs do not comply with such requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An optionee is not taxed on the grant or exercise of an ISO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The difference between the exercise price and the fair market value of the shares on the exercise date will, however, be a preference item for purposes of the alternative minimum tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an optionee holds the shares acquired upon exercise of an ISO for at least two years following the option grant date and at least one year following exercise, the optionees gain, if any, upon a subsequent disposition of such shares is long-term capital gain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The measure of the gain is the difference between the proceeds received on disposition and the optionees basis in the shares (which generally equals the exercise price).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an optionee disposes of shares acquired pursuant to exercise of an ISO before satisfying these holding periods, the optionee will recognize both ordinary income and capital gain in the year of disposition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not entitled to an income tax deduction on the grant or exercise of an ISO or on the optionees disposition of the shares after satisfying the holding period requirement described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the holding periods are not satisfied, we will be entitled to a deduction in the year the optionee disposes of the shares in an amount equal to the ordinary income recognized by the optionee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order for an option to qualify for ISO tax treatment, the grant of the option must satisfy various other conditions more fully described in the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We cannot guarantee that any option will qualify for ISO tax treatment even if the option is intended to qualify for such treatment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event an option intended to be an ISO fails to so qualify, it will be taxed as an NQSO as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An optionee is not taxed on the grant of an NQSO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On exercise, the optionee recognizes ordinary income equal to the difference between the exercise price and the fair market value of the shares acquired on the date of exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are entitled to an income tax deduction in the year of exercise in the amount recognized by the optionee as ordinary income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The optionees gain (or loss) on subsequent disposition of the shares is long-term capital gain (or loss) if the shares are held for at least one year following exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not receive a deduction for this gain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A grantee is not taxed on the grant of a stock appreciation right.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On exercise, the individual recognizes ordinary income equal to the cash or the fair market value of any shares received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are entitled to an income tax deduction in the year of exercise in the amount recognized by the individual as ordinary income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Shares and Restricted Share Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grantees of restricted shares or restricted share units do not recognize income at the time of the grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the award vests or is paid, grantees generally recognize ordinary income in an amount equal to the fair market value of the shares or units at such time, and we will receive a corresponding deduction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, no later than 30 days after a participant receives an award of restricted shares, the participant may elect to recognize taxable ordinary income in an amount equal to the fair market value of the shares at the time of receipt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provided that the election is made in a timely manner, the participant will not recognize any additional income when the restrictions on the shares lapse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant forfeits the shares any (e.g., upon the participants termination prior to vesting), the participant may not claim a deduction with respect to the income recognized as a result of the election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends paid with respect to unvested restricted shares generally will be taxable as ordinary income to the participant at the time the dividends are received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan is designed to permit the grant of options and stock appreciation rights, and certain awards of restricted shares, restricted share units, performance shares and performance share units that are intended to qualify as performance-based compensation not subject to Section 162(m)s $1,000,000 deductibility cap.

sentences.text: However, the rules and regulations promulgated under Section 162(m) are complicated and subject to change from time to time, sometimes with retroactive effect.

sentences.text: In addition, a number of requirements must be met in order for particular compensation to so qualify.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reports to and acts on behalf of the Board of Directors of the company by providing oversight of the financial management, internal auditors, independent auditor and financial reporting controls and accounting policies and procedures of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys management is responsible for preparing the companys financial statements and systems of internal control and the independent auditor is responsible for auditing those financial statements and expressing its opinion as to whether the financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position, results of operations and cash flows of the company in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for overseeing the conduct of these activities by the companys management and the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this context, the Audit Committee has met and held discussions with management and the internal and independent auditors (including private sessions with the Vice President, Internal Audit, the independent auditor, the Chief Financial Officer, and the General Counsel at each Audit Committee meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management represented to the Audit Committee that the companys consolidated financial statements as of and for the fiscal year ended January 1, 2017 were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and the Audit Committee has reviewed and discussed the consolidated financial statements with management and the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has discussed with the independent auditor matters required to be discussed by the applicable Auditing Standards as periodically amended (including significant accounting policies, alternative accounting treatments and estimates, judgments and uncertainties).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee has received the written disclosures and the letter from the independent auditor required by the applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the independent auditors communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence, and the Audit Committee and the independent auditor have discussed the auditors independence from the company and its management, including the matters in those written disclosures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Audit Committee considered the non-audit services provided by the independent auditor and the fees and costs billed and expected to be billed by the independent auditor for those services (as shown on page 85 of this Proxy Statement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the non-audit services provided by the independent auditor since February 10, 2003, and the fees and costs incurred in connection with those services, have been pre-approved by the Audit Committee in accordance with the Audit and Non- Audit Services Pre-Approval Policy, as adopted by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (This policy is discussed in further detail on page 86 of this Proxy Statement.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When approving the retention of the independent auditor for these non-audit services, the Audit Committee has considered whether the retention of the independent auditor to provide those services is compatible with maintaining auditor independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reliance on the reviews and discussions with management and the independent auditor referred to above, the Audit Committee believes that the non-audit services provided by the independent auditor are compatible with, and did not impair, auditor independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also has discussed with the companys internal and independent auditors, with and without management present, their evaluations of the companys internal accounting controls and the overall quality of the companys financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In further reliance on the reviews and discussions with management and the independent auditor referred to above, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Directors on February 27, 2017, and the Board has approved, the inclusion of the audited financial statements in the companys Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended January 1, 2017, for filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has appointed PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the independent registered public accounting firm for the company and its subsidiaries for the fiscal year 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder ratification of the appointment is not required under the laws of the State of New Jersey, but as a matter of good corporate governance, the Board has decided to ascertain the position of the shareholders on the appointment at the Annual Meeting.

sentences.text: During fiscal years 2016 and 2015, PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP not only acted as the independent registered public accounting firm for the company and its subsidiaries (work related to the integrated audit of our consolidated financial statements and internal control over financial reporting), but also rendered other services on behalf of the company and its subsidiaries.

sentences.text: All Other Fees  Consists of fees not included in the Audit, Audit-Related or Tax categories and includes reviews for compliance with various government regulations relating to the health care industry and privacy standards, supply chain operational reviews and risk management reviews and assessments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-Approval of Audit and Non-Audit Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Audit and Non-Audit Services Pre-Approval Policy, as adopted by the Audit Committee in 2003, the Audit Committee must pre-approve all audit and non-audit services provided by the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Policy, as described below, sets forth the procedures and conditions for such pre-approval of services to be performed by the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Policy utilizes both a framework of general pre-approval for certain specified services and specific pre-approval for all other services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the first quarter of each year, the Audit Committee is asked to pre-approve the engagement of the independent auditor, and the projected fees, for audit services, audit-related services (assurance and related services that are reasonably related to the performance of the auditors review of the financial statements or that are traditionally performed by the independent auditor) and tax services (such as tax compliance, tax planning and tax advice) for the current year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the following specific routine and recurring other services may also be pre-approved generally for the current year: audits or reviews of third parties to assess compliance with contracts; risk management reviews and assessments; dispute analysis; health care compliance reviews; and other regulatory matters and certain projects to evaluate systems security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fee amounts approved at such first quarter meeting are updated to the extent necessary at the regularly scheduled meetings of he Audit Committee during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional pre-approval is required if actual fees for any service exceed the originally pre- approved amount by 5%, excluding the impact of currency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we want to engage the independent auditor for other services that are not considered subject to general pre-approval as described above, then the Audit Committee must approve such specific engagement, as well as the projected fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional pre-approval is required before any fees can exceed those fees approved for any such specifically-approved services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we wish to engage the independent auditor for additional services that have not been generally pre-approved as described above, then such engagement will be presented to the Audit Committee for pre-approval at its next regularly scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the timing of the project requires an expedited decision, then we may ask the Chairman of the Audit Committee to pre-approve such engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such pre-approval by the Chairman is then reported to the other Committee members at the next Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In any event, pre-approval of any engagement by the Audit Committee or the Chairman of the Audit Committee is required before the independent auditor may commence any engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, there were no fees paid to PricewaterhouseCoopers under a de minimis exception to the rules that waives pre-approval for certain non-audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of PricewaterhouseCoopers are expected to be present at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders and will be allowed to make a statement if they wish.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, they will be available to respond to appropriate questions from shareholders during the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that shareholders vote FOR ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement - 86
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 6: Shareholder Proposal  Independent Board Chairman
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following shareholder proposal has been submitted to the company for action at the meeting by The Sisters of St. Francis of Philadelphia, c/o Office of Corporate Social Responsibility, 609 South Convent Road, Aston, PA 19014, a beneficial owner of 45 shares of the companys common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of the shares voted at the meeting is required for approval of the shareholder proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The text of the proposal follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Johnson & Johnson - Separate Chair & CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED: The shareholders request the Board of Directors to adopt as policy, and amend the bylaws as necessary, to require the Chair of the Board of Directors, whenever possible, to be an independent member of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy would be phased in for the next CEO transition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Board determines that a Chair who was independent when selected is no longer independent, the Board shall select a new Chair who satisfies the requirements of the policy within a reasonable amount of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance with this policy is waived if no independent director is available and willing to serve as Chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supporting Statement:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The role of the CEO and management is to run the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The role of the Board of Directors is to provide independent oversight of management and the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is a potential conflict of interest for a CEO to be her/his own overseer as Chair while managing the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Johnson & Johnson's CEO Alex Gorsky serves both as CEO and Chair of the Company's Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the combination of these two roles in a single person weakens a corporation's governance structure, which can harm shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Andrew Grove, Intel's former chair, stated, "The separation of the two jobs goes to the heart of the conception of a corporation. Is a company a sandbox for the CEO, or is the CEO an employee? If he's an employee, he needs a boss, and that boss is the Board. The Chairman runs the Board. How can the CEO be his own boss?"
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our view, shareholders are best served by an independent Board Chair who can provide a balance of power between the CEO and the Board empowering strong Board leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary duty of a Board of Directors is to oversee the management of a company on behalf of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe a combined CEO I Chair creates a potential conflict of interest, resulting in excessive management influence on the Board and weaker oversight of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Numerous institutional investors recommend separation of these two roles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, California's Retirement System CalPERS Principles & Guidelines encourage separation, even with a lead director in place.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to ISS "2015 Board Practices", (April 2015), 53% of S&P 1,500 firms separate these two positions and the number of companies separating these roles is growing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairing and overseeing the Board is a time intensive responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A separate Chair also frees the CEO to manage the company and build effective business strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many companies have separate and/or independent Chairs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An independent Chair is the prevailing practice in the United Kingdom and is an increasing trend in the U.S.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder resolutions urging separation of CEO and Chair received approximately 33% in 2015 and 31% in 2016, an indication of strong investor support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To simplify the transition, this policy would be phased in and implemented when the next CEO is chosen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement - 87
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Boards Statement in Opposition to Shareholder Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote AGAINST the adoption of this proposal for the following reasons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adoption of a policy requiring that the Chairman of the Board be an independent director could limit the Boards ability to choose the person best suited for the role at a particular time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in Item 1: Election of Directors on pages 9 to 14 of this Proxy Statement, our Board is composed of directors with diverse backgrounds, experience, and perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, our independent directors appropriately challenge management and demonstrate the free-thinking expected of todays directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given this makeup, our Board is in a very strong position to evaluate the pros and cons of the various types of board leadership structures and to ultimately decide which one best serves the interests of our stakeholders, as they are defined in Our Credo.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the views of shareholders are important when determining the most appropriate board leadership structure, it is incumbent upon the Board, and is ultimately the Board's duty, to decide what leadership structure will most effectively serve the interests of Johnson & Johnson and our stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes it is crucial to maintain the flexibility to tailor its leadership structure to best fit the companys specific circumstances, culture, and short- and long-term challenges as they evolve over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that our current governance structure already provides the independent leadership and oversight sought by the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recognizes the importance of having in place, and building upon, a strong structure to ensure that the Board functions in an appropriately independent manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the same time that our Board decided to designate Mr. Gorsky as Chairman in 2012, our independent Directors took steps to enhance our governance structure by converting the Presiding Director role to that of an independent Lead Director and expanding the duties of the independent Lead Director to include all of the responsibilities and authorities of the companys former Presiding Director position as well as several additional responsibilities and authorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As presently structured, the independent Lead Directors duties include the following, among other things:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approving information sent to the Board and determining timeliness of information flow from management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approving meeting schedules to assure that there is sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing in advance the schedule of committee meetings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participating in setting, and ultimately approving, the agenda for each Board meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having the authority to call meetings and Executive Sessions of the independent Directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Presiding at all meetings of the Board at which the Chair/CEO is not present, including Executive Sessions of the independent Directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitoring the flow of information from Committee Chairs to the full Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leading the annual performance evaluation of the Chair/CEO, distinguishing as necessary between performance as Chair and performance as CEO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leading the annual performance evaluation of the Board; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leading the CEO succession process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table on page 17 of this Proxy Statement describes the duties and responsibilities of our independent Lead Director in greater detail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each of the Boards five main committees is composed entirely of independent Directors with an independent Director chairing each such committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gorsky is currently the only non-independent member of our Board, and he is not a member of any of our Boards five main committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that our existing leadership structure is most effective for the company under current circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that it remains in our companys best interests for Mr. Gorsky to serve as Chairman of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having Mr. Gorsky, our company's CEO, serve as Chairman creates clear and unambiguous authority, which is essentia to effective management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, given that he is closer to our companys businesses than any other Board member and has the benefit of over 20 years of operational and leadership experience within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, Mr. Gorsky is best positioned to provide effective leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gorskys career experience gives him unsurpassed industry knowledge, which the Board believes is critical for the chairman of the board of a company that operates in a highly-regulated industry, such as health care.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board, through its Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee, will continue to periodically review its leadership structure in a serious and open-minded fashion to ensure it remains appropriate for our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our Board believes that it continues to be in the companys best interests for Mr. Gorsky to serve as Chairman of our Board, the Board is committed to regularly considering all board leadership structures and assessing the role that independent directors play in the leadership of the board, including at the time of the next leadership succession.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board will continue to monitor this topic in light of what it observes in the marketplace, the evolution of viewpoints in the corporate governance community, and, most importantly, what the Board believes is in the best interests of Johnson & Johnson and its stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t is, therefore, recommended that shareholders vote AGAINST this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement is furnished in connection with the solicitation of proxies by our Board of Directors for the Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement, accompanying proxy form and our 2016 Annual Report to Shareholders are being distributed to our shareholders on or about March 15, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To constitute a quorum a majority of the shares entitled to vote must be represented in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of each matter submitted to the shareholders, including the election of Directors, requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of determining the number of votes cast with respect to a particular matter, only those cast For or Against are included; abstentions and broker non-votes are counted only for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are encouraged to vote in advance of the meeting using one of the following voting methods, even if you are planning to attend the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Make sure you have your Notice, proxy card or vote instruction form in hand and follow the instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Registered Shareholders: Shareholders who hold their shares directly with our stock registrar, Computershare, can vote any one of four ways:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Telephone: Call (800) 690-6903 and follow the instructions given by the voice prompts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote via the Internet or by telephone, your voting instructions may be transmitted up until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time on April 26, 2017, except with respect to shares held in a Johnson & Johnson employee savings plan, which must be submitted by 5:00 p.m. on April 25, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Johnson & Johnson Employee Savings Plans below for voting instructions regarding shares held under our savings plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Mail: If you received paper copies of the Proxy Statement, Annual Report and proxy card, mark, sign, date and return the proxy card in the postage-paid envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Person: Attend the Annual Meeting, or send a personal representative with an appropriate proxy, to vote by ballot at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (See Annual Meeting Information and Admission Ticket Procedures.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Shareholders: Shareholders who hold their shares beneficially through an institutional holder of record such as a bank or broker (sometimes referred to as holding shares in street name), will receive voting instructions from that holder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to vote in person at the meeting, you must obtain a legal proxy from the holder of record of your shares and present it at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement - 90
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice and Access We distribute proxy materials to many shareholders via the Internet under the SECs Notice and Access rules to save costs and paper.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using this method of distribution, on or about March 15, 2017, we mailed a Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials (Notice) that contains basic information about our 2017 Annual Meeting and instructions on how to view all proxy materials, and vote electronically, on the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you receive the Notice and prefer to receive the proxy materials by regular mail or delivered to your e-mail address, follow the instructions in the Notice for making this request, and the materials will be sent promptly to you via the preferred method.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you prefer to vote by phone rather than Internet, the website listed on the Notice (www.proxyvote.com) has instructions for voting by phone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effect of Your Proxy Your proxy authorizes another person to vote your shares on your behalf at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your valid proxy is timely received by internet, telephone, or mail, the persons designated as proxies will vote your shares per your directions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have designated two of our officers as proxies for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders  D.J. Caruso and M.H. Ullmann.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Should any other matter not referred to in this Proxy Statement properly come before the meeting, the designated proxies will vote in their discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any Director nominee should refuse or be unable to serve, an event that is not anticipated, your shares will be voted for the person designated by the Board of Directors to replace such nominee or, alternatively, the Board of Directors may reduce the number of Directors on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effect of Not Casting Your Vote Registered Shareholders: When a valid proxy is received, but specific choices are not indicated, the designated proxies will vote as recommended by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Shareholders: It is critical that you cast your vote if you want it to count in the election of Directors and most other items on the agenda.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under applicable regulations, if you hold your shares beneficially and do not instruct your bank, broker or other holder of record on how to vote your shares, the holder of record will only have discretion to vote your uninstructed shares on the ratification of the appointment of our independent registered public accounting firm (Item 5).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The holder of record will not have discretion to vote your uninstructed shares on the election of directors (Item 1), the advisory vote on frequency of voting to approve named executive officer compensation (Item 2), the advisory vote to approve named executive officer compensation (Item 3), the re-approval of the material terms of performance goals under the 2012 Long-Term Incentive Plan (Item 4), or the shareholder proposal (Item 6), resulting in broker non-votes on those items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revoking Your Proxy or Changing Your Vote You may change your vote at any time before the proxy is exercised.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Registered Shareholders:  If you voted by mail: you may revoke your proxy at any time before it is exercised by executing and delivering a timely and valid later-dated proxy, by voting by ballot at the meeting or by giving written notice to the Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you voted via the Internet or by telephone: you may change your vote with a timely and valid later Internet or telephone vote, or by voting by ballot at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the meeting will not have the effect of revoking a proxy unless (1) you give proper written notice of revocation to the Corporate Secretary before the proxy is exercised, or (2) you vote by ballot at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Shareholders: Follow the specific directions provided by your bank, broker or other holder of record to change or revoke any voting instructions you have already provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, you may vote your shares by ballot at the meeting if you obtain a legal proxy from your holder of record and present it at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Johnson & Johnson Employee Savings Plans If you hold shares in a Johnson & Johnson company employee savings plan, you will receive one proxy card or Notice that covers the shares held for you in your savings plan, as well as any other shares registered directly in your name (but not shares held beneficially through a bank, broker or other holder of record).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote the plan shares via the Internet, by telephone or by mail, as described above, by 5:00 p.m. (Eastern) on April 25, 2017, the Trustee of your savings plan will vote your shares as you have directed (your voting instructions will be kept confidential).

sentences.text: Under this procedure, registered shareholders, who have the same address and last name and who receive either Notices or paper copies of the proxy materials in the mail, will receive only one copy of our proxy materials, or a single envelope containing the Notices for all shareholders at that address.

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposals, Director Nominations by Shareholders and Other Items of Business
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rule 14a-8: To be included in the Proxy Statement and proxy card for the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, a shareholder proposal must be received at our principal office on or before November 15, 2017 and must comply with Rule 14a-8 under the U.S. Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Access: As discussed on page 22 of this Proxy Statement, last year we amended our By- Laws to implement proxy access, which allows a shareholder or a group of up to 20 shareholders owning shares representing at least 3% of the common stock of the company continuously for at least three years, to nominate and include in our Proxy Statement their own Director nominee(s) constituting up to 20% of the total number of Directors then serving on the Board (with a minimum of up to two Director nominees if the Board size is less than 10), provided that the shareholder(s) and the nominee(s) satisfy the requirements in our By-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of Director nominees for the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders must include the information required under our By-Laws and must be received by our Corporate Secretary at our principal office no earlier than the close of business (5:00 p.m. Eastern Time) on October 16, 2017 and no later than the close of business on November 15, 2017, unless the date of the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders has been changed by more than 30 calendar days.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that case, such notice must be received by our Corporate Secretary no earlier than the close of business on the 90th calendar day before the date we commence mailing of our proxy materials in connection with the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and no later than the close of business on the later of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the 60th calendar day before the date we commence mailing of our proxy materials in connection with the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the 10th calendar day following the day on which public announcement of the date of the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders is first made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advance Notice Provisions: In addition, under the terms of our By-Laws, a shareholder who intends to present an item of business (including a Director nomination) at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders (other than a proposal submitted or a Director candidate nominated for inclusion in our proxy materials) must provide us with written notice of such business at our principal office, including the information specified in the By-Laws, which must be received during the same windows as those described above under Proxy Access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals and other items of business should be directed to the attention of the Office of the Corporate Secretary at the address of our principal office: One Johnson & Johnson Plaza, New Brunswick, New Jersey 08933.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can contact any of our Directors, including our Lead Director, by writing to them c/o Johnson & Johnson, Office of the Corporate Secretary, One Johnson & Johnson Plaza, New Brunswick, NJ 08933.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees and others who wish to contact the Board or any member of the Audit Committee to report any complaint or concern with respect to accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters, may do so anonymously by using the address above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can also use the online submission forms on our website to contact the Board and the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our process for handling communications to the Board or the individual Directors has been approved by the independent Directors and can be found at www.investor.jnj.com/communication.cfm.
